Class Matrix4

java.lang.Object
raja.Matrix4
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Writable
public class Matrix4 extends Object implements Serializable, Writable
Represents a 4x4 matrix for 3D transformations (translation, rotation, scaling).
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • identity

      public static Matrix4 identity()
      Returns an identity (unit) 4x4 matrix. An identity matrix has 1s on the main diagonal and 0s elsewhere. It represents no translation, rotation, or scaling.
      Returns:
      A new 4x4 identity matrix.

    • getRotationMatrix

      public Matrix4 getRotationMatrix()
      Returns the rotation component of this transformation matrix by removing translation and scaling. This extracts only the rotational part, normalizing the basis vectors to remove scale effects. Useful for transforming normal vectors without distorting their length.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix4 containing only the rotation component

    • set

      public void set(int row, int col, double value)
      Sets the value at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-3)
      col - The column index (0-3)
      value - The value to set
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if row or col is not in [0, 3]

    • getScaleX

      public double getScaleX()
      Gets the X-axis scale factor from this transformation matrix. This is calculated as the magnitude of the X basis vector.
      Returns:
      The X scale factor

    • getScaleY

      public double getScaleY()
      Gets the Y-axis scale factor from this transformation matrix. This is calculated as the magnitude of the Y basis vector.
      Returns:
      The Y scale factor

    • getScaleZ

      public double getScaleZ()
      Gets the Z-axis scale factor from this transformation matrix. This is calculated as the magnitude of the Z basis vector.
      Returns:
      The Z scale factor

    • transformRay

      public Ray transformRay(Ray ray)

    • transformDirection

      public Vector3D transformDirection(Vector3D v)
      Transforms a direction vector by this matrix. Unlike points, vectors are not affected by translation. Only the rotational and scaling components are applied. This is used for transforming normal vectors, ray directions, etc.
      Parameters:
      v - The direction vector to transform
      Returns:
      A new transformed Vector3

    • get

      public double get(int row, int col)
      Provides access to a specific element of the matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-3).
      col - The column index (0-3).
      Returns:
      The matrix element at the specified position.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the row or column index is invalid.

    • transformNormal

      public Vector3D transformNormal(Vector3D normal)

    • multiply

      public Matrix4 multiply(Matrix4 other)
      Multiplies this matrix by another matrix.
      Parameters:
      other - The other Matrix4 to multiply with.
      Returns:
      The resulting Matrix4.

    • transformPoint

      public Point3D transformPoint(Point3D point)
      Transforms a Point3 by this matrix (includes translation). For affine transformations, the W component of the transformed point should be 1.0.
      Parameters:
      point - The Point3 to transform.
      Returns:
      The transformed Point3.

    • transformVector

      public Vector3D transformVector(Vector3D vector)
      Transforms a Vector3 by this matrix (only rotation and scaling, no translation).
      Parameters:
      vector - The Vector3 to transform.
      Returns:
      The transformed Vector3.

    • inverse

      public Matrix4 inverse()
      Returns the inverse of this matrix. Returns null if the matrix is non-invertible. This method is designed for affine transformations (rotation, translation, uniform scaling). Formula: [ R | t ]^-1 = [ R^-1 | -R^-1 * t ] Where R is the upper-left 3x3 submatrix and t is the translation vector.
      Returns:
      The inverse Matrix4 or null.

    • negation

      public Matrix4 negation()
      Returns a new matrix that is the negation of this matrix. Each element in the resulting matrix is the negative of the corresponding element in this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix4 representing the negation of this matrix

    • inverseTransposeForNormal

      public Matrix4 inverseTransposeForNormal()
      Computes the inverse transpose of the upper 3x3 part of this matrix. This is typically used to transform normal vectors correctly when the model matrix contains non-uniform scaling. For pure rotations, the inverse is equal to the transpose.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix4 representing the inverse transpose of the 3x3 part, with the translation components set to zero. Returns null if the upper 3x3 part is non-invertible.

    • translate

      public static Matrix4 translate(Vector3D translation)
      Creates a translation matrix.
      Parameters:
      translation - The translation vector.
      Returns:
      The translation Matrix4.

    • scale

      public static Matrix4 scale(double sx, double sy, double sz)

      Returns:
      The scaling Matrix4.

    • transpose

      public Matrix4 transpose()

    • rotate

      public static Matrix4 rotate(Vector3D axis, double angle)
      Creates a rotation matrix around an arbitrary axis by the specified angle. Uses Rodrigues' rotation formula.
      Parameters:
      axis - the rotation axis (will be normalized)
      angle - the rotation angle in radians
      Returns:
      the rotation matrix

    • fromMatrix3

      public static Matrix4 fromMatrix3(Matrix3 m3)
      Creates a Matrix4 from a Matrix3 (typically to extend rotation matrices to 4x4).
      Parameters:
      m3 - The Matrix3 to extend.
      Returns:
      The created Matrix4.

    • scale

      public static Matrix4 scale(double s)
      Creates a scaling matrix that scales uniformly along all axes.
      Parameters:
      s - The uniform scale factor.
      Returns:
      The scaling Matrix4.

    • scaleX

      public static Matrix4 scaleX(double sx)
      Creates a scaling matrix that scales only along the X-axis.
      Parameters:
      sx - The X-axis scale factor.
      Returns:
      The scaling Matrix4.

    • rotate

      public static Matrix4 rotate(double angleDegrees, Vector3D axis)
      Creates a rotation matrix that rotates around an arbitrary axis defined by a unit vector. The input angle is in degrees; conversion to radians is handled internally.
      Parameters:
      angleDegrees - The rotation angle in degrees.
      axis - The unit vector representing the axis of rotation.
      Returns:
      The rotation Matrix4.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the axis vector is zero-length.

    • rotateXYZ

      public static Matrix4 rotateXYZ(double xAngleDegrees, double yAngleDegrees, double zAngleDegrees)
      Creates a rotation matrix by applying rotations around the X, Y, and Z axes in XYZ order. Input angles are in degrees; conversion to radians is handled internally via rotateX/Y/Z. This is equivalent to: R = Rz(z) * Ry(y) * Rx(x) Note: Rotation order mattersâthis uses intrinsic Tait-Bryan angles (XYZ convention).
      Parameters:
      xAngleDegrees - Rotation angle around the X-axis in degrees.
      yAngleDegrees - Rotation angle around the Y-axis in degrees.
      zAngleDegrees - Rotation angle around the Z-axis in degrees.
      Returns:
      The combined rotation Matrix4.
